member.name: T:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock
member.summary: Provides enhanced and customizable form-docking capabilities to borderless Windows Forms.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new Bunifu Form Dock component.

member.name: T:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.BunifuWindowStates
member.summary: Provides a general list of window-states available for use in borderless Forms displayed on-screen. This mimics the standard enumeration but has been tailored for handling borderless forms.

member.summary: A normal window.

member.summary: A minimized window.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AllowHidingBottomRegion
member.summary: When set to true, a white region that is drawn at the bottom of the parent form will be hidden; however, when set to false, this region will be exposed at runtime.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.BorderOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets Form border options that can be used to add and style borders on the parent form.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.DockingOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the docking options to be used in the parent form.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.TitleBarOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of options for selecting and managing any control that is set as the parent form's Title Bar.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AllowDockingKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parent form will allow the standard Windows docking keys to be supported at runtime.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AllowFormDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parent form will be draggable.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AllowFormDropShadow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parent form will have a drop-shadow along its borders..

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AllowFormResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parent form will be resizable when borderless.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AllowOpacityChangesWhileDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parent form's opacity or transparency will be changed whenever it's being dragged on screen.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.ShowCursorChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether cursor-changes will be provided when about to dock the parent form.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.ShowDockingIndicators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the docking indicators will be previewed before the parent form is docked.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.DockingIndicatorsColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the docking indicators.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.DockingIndicatorsOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity or transparency of the docking indicators.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.FormDraggingOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity or transparency of the parent form when dragging.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.WindowState
member.summary: Gets or sets the window-state for the form. This mimics the standard enumeration but has been tailored for handling borderless forms.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.BunifuWindowState
member.summary: Gets or sets the window-state for the form. This mimics the standard enumeration but has been tailored for handling borderless forms.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.ContainerControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the container control within the parent form. In most cases, this refers and results to the parent form.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.ParentForm
member.summary: Gets or sets the container control as the parent form.

member.name: P:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.Site
member.summary: Overrides the ISite functionality, getting the main or parent container control in the Form. This is overriden to get the component's host or parent form.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.ApplyShadows
member.summary: Applies a surrounding shadow to the target form.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.AddBottomSeparator(System.Drawing.Color,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a bottom Line Separator to the attached Parent Form.
member.param: Sets the background color of the Separator.
Sets the height of the Separator.

Allow docking the Separator to the bottom area? (Disabled by default) If allowed, the Separator will be docked to the bottom-most area of the Parent Form; else, it will be anchored to the bottom-most area. Both options however perform the same way at runtime.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.SubscribeControlToDragEvents(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes any control specified to the drag event operations performed on the parent form.
member.param: The control to be subscribed to the drag events.
If the control is a part of the Title Bar section, set this parameter to true in order for the control to be subscribed to the setting.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.SubscribeControlsToDragEvents(System.Windows.Forms.Control[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes an array of controls specified to the drag event operations performed on the parent form.
member.param: An array of controls to be subscribed to the drag events.
If the controls are part of the Title Bar section, set this parameter to true in order for the controls to be subscribed to the setting.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.UnsubscribeControlToDragEvents(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unsubscribes any control attached to the drag event operations performed on the parent form.
member.param: The control previously attached to the drag events.
If the control was a part of the Title Bar section, set this parameter to true in order for the control to be unsubscribed to the setting.

member.name: M:Bunifu.UI.WinForms.BunifuFormDock.UnsubscribeControlsToDragEvents(System.Windows.Forms.Control[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unsubscribes an array of controls attached to the drag event operations performed on the parent form.
member.param: An array of controls previously attached to the drag events.
If the controls were part of the Title Bar section, set this parameter to true in order for the controls to be unsubscribed to the setting.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.IManagedType
member.summary: Interface for all types we can perform transitions on. Each type (e.g. int, double, Color) that we can perform a transition on needs to have its own class that implements this interface. These classes tell the transition system how to act on objects of that type.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.IManagedType.getManagedType
member.summary: Returns the Type that the instance is managing.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.IManagedType.copy(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of the object passed in. (In particular this is needed for types that are objects.)

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.IManagedType.getIntermediateValue(System.Object,System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns an object holding the value between the start and end corresponding to the percentage passed in. (Note: the percentage can be less than 0% or greater than 100%.)

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.ITransitionType.onTimer(System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Called by the Transition framework when its timer ticks to pass in the time (in ms) since the transition started.
You should return (in an out parameter) the percentage movement towards the destination value for the time passed in. Note: this does not need to be a smooth transition from 0% to 100%. You can overshoot with values greater than 100% or undershoot if you need to (for example, to have some form of "elasticity").
The percentage should be returned as (for example) 0.1 for 10%.
You should return (in an out parameter) whether the transition has completed. (This may not be at the same time as the percentage has moved to 100%.)

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.ManagedType_Color
member.summary: Class that manages transitions for Color properties. For these we need to transition the R, G, B and A sub-properties independently.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.ManagedType_Color.getManagedType
member.summary: Returns the type we are managing.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.Transition
member.summary:
Lets you perform animated transitions of properties on arbitrary objects. These will often be transitions of UI properties, for example an animated fade-in of a UI object, or an animated move of a UI object from one position to another.
Each transition can simulataneously change multiple properties, including properties across multiple objects.
Example transition ------------------ a. Transition t = new Transition(new TransitionMethod_Linear(500)); b. t.add(form1, "Width", 500); c. t.add(form1, "BackColor", Color.Red); d. t.run();
Line a: Creates a new transition. You specify the transition method.
Lines b. and c: Set the destination values of the properties you are animating.
Line d: Starts the transition.
Transition methods ------------------ TransitionMethod objects specify how the transition is made. Examples include linear transition, ease-in-ease-out and so on. Different transition methods may need different parameters.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionManager
member.summary: This class is responsible for running transitions. It holds the timer that triggers transaction animation.
member.remarks:
This class is a singleton.
We manage the transaction timer here so that we can have a single timer across all transactions. If each transaction has its own timer, this creates one thread for each transaction, and this can lead to too many threads in an application.
This class essentially just manages the timer for the transitions. It calls back into the running transitions, which do the actual work of the transition.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionManager.getInstance
member.summary: Singleton's getInstance method.

member.summary: You register a transition with the manager here. This will start to run the transition as the manager's timer ticks.

member.summary: Finds any properties in the old-transition that are also in the new one, and removes them from the old one.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Acceleration
member.summary: Manages transitions under constant acceleration from a standing start.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Acceleration.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the time that the transition will take (in milliseconds).

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Acceleration.onTimer(System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Works out the percentage completed given the time passed in. This uses the formula: s = ut + 1/2at^2 The initial velocity is 0, and the acceleration to get to 1.0 at t=1.0 is 2, so the formula just becomes: s = t^2

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Bounce
member.summary: This transition bounces the property to a destination value and back to the original value. It is accelerated to the destination and then decelerated back as if being dropped with gravity and bouncing back against gravity.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Bounce.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the total time taken for the bounce.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_CriticalDamping
member.summary: This transition animates with an exponential decay. This has a damping effect similar to the motion of a needle on an electomagnetically controlled dial.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_CriticalDamping.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the time that the transition will take (in milliseconds).

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Deceleration
member.summary: Manages a transition starting from a high speed and decelerating to zero by the end of the transition.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Deceleration.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the time that the transition will take (in milliseconds).

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Deceleration.onTimer(System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Works out the percentage completed given the time passed in. This uses the formula: s = ut + 1/2at^2 The initial velocity is 2, and the acceleration to get to 1.0 at t=1.0 is -2, so the formula becomes: s = t(2-t)

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_EaseInEaseOut
member.summary: Manages an ease-in-ease-out transition. This accelerates during the first half of the transition, and then decelerates during the second half.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_EaseInEaseOut.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the time that the transition will take (in milliseconds).

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_EaseInEaseOut.onTimer(System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Works out the percentage completed given the time passed in. This uses the formula: s = ut + 1/2at^2 We accelerate as at the rate needed (a=4) to get to 0.5 at t=0.5, and then decelerate at the same rate to end up at 1.0 at t=1.0.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Flash
member.summary: This transition type 'flashes' the properties a specified number of times, ending up by reverting them to their initial values. You specify the number of bounces and the length of each bounce.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Flash.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: You specify the number of bounces and the time taken for each bounce.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Linear
member.summary: This class manages a linear transition. The percentage complete for the transition increases linearly with time.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Linear.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the time (in milliseconds) that the transition will take.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_Linear.onTimer(System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: We return the percentage completed.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_ThrowAndCatch
member.summary: This transition bounces the property to a destination value and back to the original value. It is decelerated to the destination and then acclerated back as if being thrown against gravity and then descending back with gravity.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_ThrowAndCatch.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor. You pass in the total time taken for the bounce.

member.name: T:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_UserDefined
member.summary:
This class allows you to create user-defined transition types. You specify these as a list of TransitionElements. Each of these defines: End time , End value, Interpolation method
For example, say you want to make a bouncing effect with a decay:
EndTime% EndValue% Interpolation -------- --------- ------------- 50 100 Acceleration 75 50 Deceleration 85 100 Acceleration 91 75 Deceleration 95 100 Acceleration 98 90 Deceleration 100 100 Acceleration
The time values are expressed as a percentage of the overall transition time. This means that you can create a user-defined transition-type and then use it for transitions of different lengths.
The values are percentages of the values between the start and end values of the properties being animated in the transitions. 0% is the start value and 100% is the end value.
The interpolation is one of the values from the InterpolationMethod enum.
So the example above accelerates to the destination (as if under gravity) by t=50%, then bounces back up to half the initial height by t=75%, slowing down (as if against gravity) before falling down again and bouncing to decreasing heights each time.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.TransitionType_UserDefined.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Utilities.BunifuFormDock.Transitions.Utility.raiseEvent``1(System.EventHandler{``0},System.Object,``0)
member.summary: Fires the event passed in in a thread-safe way.
member.remarks: This method loops through the targets of the event and invokes each in turn. If the target supports ISychronizeInvoke (such as forms or controls) and is set to run on a different thread, then we call BeginInvoke to marshal the event to the target thread. If the target does not support this interface (such as most non-form classes) or we are on the same thread as the target, then the event is fired on the same thread as this is called from.
